properties.areaDesc: Interior York; Coastal York; Southern Oxford; Southern Carroll
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 6:05PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
At 604 PM EST...A snow squall was along a line extending from near
Effingham to near Ossipee...and moving east, southeast at 30 MPH.

Locations impacted include...
Biddeford, Alfred, Ossipee, Saco, Kennebunk, Buxton, Hollis,
Kennebunkport, Effingham, Cornish, Old Orchard Beach, Waterboro,
Wolfeboro, Lyman, Arundel, Limington, Limerick, Acton, Freedom and
Dayton.

This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 27 and 39.

This also includes...
Fortunes Rock Beach.

* Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this
snow squall.

* Sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are
possible in this snow squall.

Temperatures are above freezing...but sharply colder temperatures
following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on
roads and sidewalks. Untreated road surfaces will become extremely
slippery. Reduced speeds and distance between vehicles is advised.

NWSheadline: A snow squall will affect northern York and southeastern Carroll Counties
